content.text:
[Tue 2026-02-17 02:31 EST] A subagent task "Read and follow CODING.md for all workflow rules.
    USE GIT WORKTREE â€” do NOT checkout in the main repo. Create: git worktree add /tmp/bills-bot-feat-rest-api feat/rest-api
    CLAUDE CODE â€” use `claude --model opus --effort high --dangerously-skip-permissions '<task>'` for ALL programming. Do NOT hand-write code with edit/write tools. --model opus --effort high --dangerously-skip-permissions is REQUIRED.
    CODESESSION â€” cd into worktree FIRST, then:
    - cs start FIRST (auto-resolves by git root â€” parallel-safe as long as each agent uses its own worktree)
    - cs log-ai after EVERY Claude Code call (extract token counts â€” 0 tokens = broken session)
    - cs note with DETAILED descriptions at every step (minimum 3-5, verbose)
    - cs end LAST with detailed summary
    - Final sanity check: cs status --json must show aiTokens > 0 and filesChanged > 0

    TASK: Address PR #70 review comments â€” Round 1
    PR: https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/pull/70
    Branch: feat/rest-api
    Repo: /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/

    UNRESOLVED THREADS (25 total â€” many are duplicate issues flagged by both claude and coderabbitai, fix the underlying issue once and resolve all related threads):

    1. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9e52
       FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 222
       ISSUE: ðŸ”´ CRITICAL â€” channel.send(content) bypasses mention sanitization. Must use safeSend() and sanitizeMentions().

    2. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fwP
       FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 224
       ISSUE: ðŸ”´ CRITICAL (duplicate) â€” Content must be sanitized before sending to Discord. Use sanitizeMentions() + safeSend().

    3. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9e71
       FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 209
       ISSUE: ðŸŸ¡ No content length validation. Discord messages have 2000-char limit.

    4. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9e9k
       FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 96
       ISSUE: ðŸŸ¡ Config endpoint is not guild-scoped â€” PATCH /:id/config modifies global config, not per-guild.

    5. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fwI
       FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 71
       ISSUE: ðŸŸ  MAJOR (duplicate) â€” Config endpoints return global config, not guild-scoped config. GET /:id/config calls getConfig() which returns entire bot config regardless of guild ID.

    6. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fGB
       FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 71
       ISSUE: ðŸŸ¡ Config endpoint returns entire config including sensitive data (e.g. logging.database).

    7. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9e-Q
       FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 157
       ISSUE: ðŸŸ¡ Members endpoint pagination is non-functional. page parameter parsed but never used.

    8. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fBh
       FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 137
       ISSUE: ðŸŸ¡ Pagination offset not used for Discord member fetch. Discord's fetch() uses cursor-based pagination (after param), not offset.

    9. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fwM
       FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 137
       ISSUE: ðŸŸ  MAJOR (duplicate) â€” Pagination page parameter is ineffective. guild.members.fetch({ limit }) doesn't support offset-based pagination.

    10. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9e-S
        FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 110
        ISSUE: ðŸŸ¡ Stats query counts conversations across ALL guilds, not guild-scoped. Missing WHERE clause.

    11. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fG8
        FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 114
        ISSUE: ðŸŸ¡ (duplicate) â€” conversations table query is not guild-scoped. Missing WHERE guild_id filter.

    12. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fwJ
        FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 114
        ISSUE: ðŸŸ  MAJOR (duplicate) â€” Same guild-scoped conversations count issue.

    13. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9e_G
        FILE: src/api/middleware/auth.js LINE: 25
        ISSUE: ðŸŸ¡ Timing-safe comparison should be used for secret comparison. Vulnerable to timing attacks.

    14. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fwC
        FILE: src/api/middleware/auth.js LINE: 27
        ISSUE: ðŸŸ  MAJOR (duplicate) â€” Same timing-safe comparison issue. Use crypto.timingSafeEqual().

    15. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fCy
        FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 231
        ISSUE: ðŸ”µ Nitpick â€” User input (action) reflected in error response. Sanitize or use allowlist.

    16. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fwS
        FILE: src/api/routes/guilds.js LINE: 231
        ISSUE: ðŸ”µ Trivial (duplicate) â€” Same: avoid reflecting raw user input in error responses.

    17. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fD2
        FILE: src/api/server.js LINE: 43
        ISSUE: ðŸ”µ Nitpick â€” CORS allows all origins when DASHBOARD_URL is unset. OPTIONS responds 204 without CORS headers.

    18. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fwY
        FILE: src/api/server.js LINE: 43
        ISSUE: ðŸ”µ Trivial (duplicate) â€” OPTIONS preflight responds 204 even when CORS is not configured.

    19. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fJL
        FILE: src/api/server.js LINE: 12
        ISSUE: ðŸŸ¡ Module-level mutable state prevents running multiple servers. Only tracks one server at a time.

    20. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fwZ
        FILE: src/api/server.js LINE: 82
        ISSUE: ðŸŸ¡ Minor (duplicate) â€” Calling startServer twice leaks the first server. Must close existing before overwriting.

    21. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fwX
        FILE: src/api/routes/health.js LINE: 27
        ISSUE: ðŸŸ¡ Minor â€” Health endpoint exposes detailed memory info without authentication. process.memoryUsage() data shouldn't be public.

    22. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fwF
        FILE: src/api/middleware/rateLimit.js LINE: 51
        ISSUE: ðŸ”µ Trivial â€” No mechanism to stop cleanup interval. Timer leak in tests/multi-instance. Return cleanup handle or expose destroy().

    23. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fwc
        FILE: src/index.js LINE: 458
        ISSUE: ðŸŸ¡ Minor â€” Consider resilience if API server fails to start. startServer() rejection propagates to startup().catch() and kills the bot.

    24. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fwd
        FILE: tests/api/middleware/rateLimit.test.js LINE: 87
        ISSUE: ðŸ”µ Trivial â€” Fake timers restoration could be missed on test failure. Use afterEach for vi.useRealTimers().

    25. THREAD ID: PRRT_kwDORICdSM5u9fwh
        FILE: tests/api/server.test.js LINE: 59
        ISSUE: ðŸ”µ Trivial â€” Remove redundant vi.unstubAllEnvs() calls inside individual tests (already in afterEach).

    INSTRUCTIONS:
    - Many threads are duplicates (same underlying issue flagged by multiple reviewers). Fix the code issue ONCE and resolve ALL related threads.
    - Group fixes logically: one commit per logical fix (not per thread).
    - Use conventional commits: fix: for bugs, refactor: for improvements.
    - Run full validation chain: format â†’ lint â†’ typecheck â†’ build â†’ test.
    - Resolve each thread via GraphQL mutation after fixing: gh api graphql -f query='mutation { resolveReviewThread(input: {threadId: "<THREAD_ID>"}) { thread { isResolved } } }'
    - Do NOT post a PR summary comment unless Bill explicitly asks.
    - Check for and fix merge conflicts with main at the end.
    - Report completion summary back to parent agent." just failed: Error: All models failed (3): anthropic/claude-opus-4-6: LLM request timed out. (unknown) | google/gemini-3-flash-preview: No available auth profile for google (all in cooldown or unavailable). (rate_limit) | zai/glm-5: LLM request timed out. (unknown).

Findings:
(no output)

Stats: runtime 9m47s â€¢ tokens n/a â€¢ sessionKey agent:build:subagent:85abf742-eba8-44ce-946e-5cd779571dcb â€¢ sessionId ae745944-fe03-46c4-b77a-d8fa27aa9d9a â€¢ transcript /home/bill/.openclaw/agents/build/sessions/ae745944-fe03-46c4-b77a-d8fa27aa9d9a.jsonl

Summarize this naturally for the user. Keep it brief (1-2 sentences). Flow it into the conversation naturally.
Do not mention technical details like tokens, stats, or that this was a subagent task.
You can respond with NO_REPLY if no announcement is needed (e.g., internal task with no user-facing result).
